text: Mrs. Schuyler Van Rensselaer (Mariana Griswold) is a bronze sculpture by American artist Augustus Saint-Gaudens. It was designed in 1888 and cast in 1890. This artwork portrays the American author, art critic, and reformer Mariana Griswold Van Rensselaer (1851–1934), who "championed Saint-Gaudens in articles on his public monuments and relief sculptures". The inscription on the upper center of the sculpture, ("the spirit, not the work") is a reference to Mrs. Van Rensselaer's "high-minded aesthetic ideals". The work was given in 1917 by the sitter to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. ==References== == External links == * Mrs. Schuyler Van Rensselaer on Metropolitan Museum of Art Category:19th-century sculptures Category:Bronze sculptures in New York City Category:Sculptures by Augustus Saint-Gaudens Category:Sculptures of the Metropolitan Museum of Art Category:Sculptures of women in New York City
title: Mrs. Schuyler Van Rensselaer (Mariana Griswold)
